p: Vitamin D is an essential nutrient for the body and for a healthy status as it is necessary to absorb calcium needed for bone mineralization. In addition, vitamin D influences a large number of metabolic pathways beyond bone metabolism [ 69] as vitamin D receptors are found in many cell types in the body, thus, being involved in numerous functions such as cellular and immune roles [ 88]. Therefore, this vitamin is necessary to prevent not only skeletal and muscular alterations, such as osteoporosis and rickets but also other numerous diseases.
